name: A. Odd One Out
statement:
You are given three digits a, b, c. Two of them are equal, but the third
one is different from the other two. Find the value that occurs exactly
once.
editorial:
You can write three if-statements to find the equal pair, and output the
correct answer.A shorter solution: output the bitwise of , , and . It
works, since any number ed with itself is , so the two equal numbers
will "cancel" and you will be left with the odd number out.
